intro: Triosteum molle, commonly known as soft triosteum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are often clustered in racemes, and it has heart-shaped, hairy leaves. Triosteum molle is typically found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. It is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
